item.title: Deploying Data Science
item.description: Data science is fine - but how do you actually make it usable for the business user? This small project is to give an example of a modern data science product using methods such as modularization, data gathering from external sources, continuous re-training of a machine learning model, publishing and visualizing via an API - all hosted on AWS. The main idea is to build everything around an API, and use that API for (A) controlling/triggering main fuctions such as unpdating the database, re-training the machine learning model and… (B) …making data and results available through jsons.

item.title: Classical Machine Learning
item.description: This project is two things at the same time: A workflow structure for doing machine learning (in this case: building and evaluating a model), and at the same time a collection of frequently used functions. The Goal of this project is to provide a solid template that can - after customization - be used for many of the “classical classification” and/or regression problems that might occur in a hand-on business context.

item.title: Making Business Intelligent
item.description: The best way for the business user to actually make a real use of data is to do classic Business Intelligence with software products like Tableau, QlikSense and SiSense. In various projects across different industries such as e-commerce, automotive, retail and small to medium sized production companies I developed and deployed simple yet effective data models and dashboards thus giving business users a better understanding for their business.
